intro: Leucoium, commonly known as the white corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Papaveraceae. It is characterized by its delicate, often blue or purple flowers and its preference for moist, shady environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters, with slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are clustered in racemes and bloom in early spring. Leucoium species are native to regions of Asia and are often cultivated for their ornamental value.
